page.title: 08 CHURCH OF ST NICHOLAS, ASH
page.content: In the church yard, the oldest grave stone we found was dated 1705.There is a Garden of Remembrance for ashes.On the outside of the church there are four carved faces.The glass doors on the porch are from the new school. There used to be metal railings around the tombs but in the war they were taken away to be made into guns. We went up to the vestry and saw the Parish Records,the oldest dated 1558. The Lord Chancellor's Briefs show that in 1709 Ash Parish gave to a Montreal fire disaster fund P5/5s/5d.In 1977,Ash needed money to rehang the bells so the archivist wrote to all the parishes that Ash had helped and the people of Montreal sent 3,500 pnds to the appeal. The building is mainly C13th though partly C12th.It has many fine brasses & monumental effigies,two date from 1310, a C15th wooden coffer & 1727 poorbox.
